column5: Jacob's Bait on Hwy 11. Can anyone tell me if it's open?   We have a group of 8 guys going to the Perch Fest for 3 days. We need a lot of minnows. $5.00 Scoops just doesn't cut it.
I just tried their number, 705-323-9111, no answer, maybe try again later.
I thought they had closed ..the father had died ?  The property is up for sale .  TB

Last summer I know the owner had some heart issues. A few times I went there and they were not open, it was kind of hit and miss. I had heard that he was recovering well so to hear he may have died (see above) is a bit of a surprise. It has been for sale for quite some time

It,s been for sale a long time. I have seen cars/trucks in there ,my guess is thier open still.They were during the winter months.   Yes, he had a heart attack and was recovering well.Last I heard.  Just called and YES they are open.Anytime.  After dinner were heading up to get some pinheads.  And no,Im not kidding.
Thanks Brian that is good to know.

Like I promised,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,   Her she is. 5 bucks for a scoop of pinheads.Easy 10 dozen or so.    Yer all probly wondering what I would be doing with a scoop of minnas??????????????????           Story to follow,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,Later
Sardines weren't availabe at Sobey's Brian...
Thanks Guys. I did finally get threw on the phone. She did say she is open for minnows.
glad to hear he's doing well..  What did you have for dinner brian?  TB
thought made it was a 'fish' recipe!  Pizza here.. Suckers were biting ... not !  Dam bruins  TB
